DOC.brief_summary: This study aim compare impact two version continue education activity target COPD case manager educational outcome : 1 ) participation ; 2 ) satisfaction ; 3 ) learning ; 4 ) competence ; 5 ) performance ; 6 ) patient health outcome .
DOC.brief_title: Impacts Continuing Education Activity Targeted COPD Case Managers
DOC.detailed_description: This study quasi-experimental design . The study base Expanded Outcomes Framework Planning Assessing Continung Medical Education Moore ( 2009 ) . One groupe participant attend former version continue education activity , group attend new version . Data collect T0 ( activity , hold T1 ) ; T2 ( immediately activity ) ; T3 ( 1-month post-activity ) ; T4 ( 2-month post-activity ) ; T5 ( 4-month post-activity ) ; T6 ( 10-month post-activity ) . Participation assess T0 . Satisfaction assess T2 . Learning assessed T0 T3 . Competence assess T2 . Performance assess T4 . Patient health outcome assess T5 T6 .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion attendee : Attending continue education activity Providing patient education individual COPD professional setting . Exclusion criterion attendee : Inclusion criterion COPD patient : Doctordiagnosed COPD . Exclusion criterion attendee :
